title: Hackers target Apple Store
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Hackers target Apple Store Among the infected apps was WeChat, one of the world’s most popular instant messaging applications Andrew Matthews/PA Google+ 1 of 1 Among the infected apps was WeChat, one of the world’s most popular instant messaging applications Andrew Matthews/PA James Dean Technology Correspondent Published 59 minutes ago 
Hundreds of millions of iPhones and iPads could be infected with a virus after the largest known security breach of Apple’s App Store, security researchers have warned (James Dean writes). 
More than 300 mobile apps have been infected with malicious software that can steal passwords and intercept data, according to one security firm. 
The hackers infected unofficial versions of Xcode, the software that Apple provides to computer engineers to help them to build apps. The breach will be embarrassing for Apple, which prides itself on security and checks every app for viruses before it is allowed on to the App Subscribe now

The French regulator said that the right to be forgotten could be easily circumvented if Google did not remove links from all of its search engines Designer pulls ad-blocking app Published at 12:01AM, September 21 2015 
An app that shot to the top of the download chart last week has been withdrawn after its designer said that it could hurt online publishers BT pledge to axe Indian call centres Published at 12:01AM, September 19 2015 
After complaints from unhappy customers, BT has pledged to answer more calls in the UK and eventually stop using Indian call centres altogether Virus gives poker cheats a hand online Published at 12:01AM, September 19 2015 
Hundreds of online poker players have had their computers infected with a virus that tells cybercriminals what cards they are holding, Sponsored Editorial
